intro: Hippocratea pauciflora f. novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea hippocratea, is a rare and distinctive member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring showy, papilionaceous flowers with a prominent keel. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforest habitats, where it thrives in the shade of taller vegetation. Its leaves are alternate and palmately lobed, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
